description: Erection of single storey ground floor rear extension.
decision_conditions: <p>Prior to superstructure works, detailed specification, a drainage layout and a management &amp; maintenance plan (where applicable) of the proposed sustainable drainage systems including rainwater harvesting and the soakaway, shall be submitted to, and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the LLFA. An infiltration test must be carried out to ensure that the capacity of the soil is suitable for infiltration or an alternative strategy as proposed will be implemented instead. It must be demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being discharged offsite and an overall reduction in peak flow rate and volume.</p><p>REASON: To support sustainable drainage</p>

<p>Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved a minimum of two Swift nesting bricks and/or boxes shall be provided at or close to eaves level of the development hereby approved. The bricks/boxes shall be retained thereafter in perpetuity.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interests of biodiversity</p>

All new external facing and roofing materials in respect of all the works hereby approved (and any other incidental works carried out in this connection) shall match those of the existing building in respect of materials used, detailed execution and finished appearance.


REASON:  To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.
